    • getVictoryPoints

      public int getVictoryPoints()
      Returns the sum of player's victory points taking in consideration:
      • productionCards (hidden or not);
      • leaderCards if active;
      • popePasses if active;
      • current position on board;
      • all resources stored in warehouse,lootchest and StorageAbility LeaderCards.

    • countAllResources

      public int countAllResources()
      Count all the resources the players have in their warehouse, lootchest and extra storage given by leader cards.

    • buyProductionCard

      public void buyProductionCard​(ConcreteProductionCard card, int stack, java.util.List<LeaderCard> leaders, ResourcesWallet resourcesWallet) throws BadStorageException, WrongLevelException
      Buy the specified ProductionCard and place it onto the specified stack.

      This will remove the card from the game production deck

      Player can decide to play a LeaderCard that may affect the cost of the chosen ProductionCard. Its applicability will be checked by the method.

      Parameters:
      card - chosen card for the transaction
      stack - indicates on which board's stack the player wants to place the card
      leaders - LeaderCards: just DiscountAbility might have an effect here
      resourcesWallet - resources distributed among different types of storage as the player wish to spend them
      Throws:
      BadStorageException
      WrongLevelException

    • buyFromMarket

      public void buyFromMarket​(char dim, int index, java.util.List<BiElement<MarbleAbility,​java.lang.Integer>> leaders)
      Obtains the resources chosen from market by column or row.

      Add faith points to the player if a red marble has been drawn.

      Parameters:
      dim - 'c' for column, 'r' for row.
      index - range 1-4 for column, 1-3 for row

    • discardResources

      public void discardResources​(java.util.List<Resource> resources)
      Discard resources when there is no space left in the warehouse. Blank and Faith types of resources won't be taken in consideration since it's not possible to discard Faith.

      Alert Game that will add Faith Points to other players.

      Parameters:
      resources - resources list to discard

    • discardResources

      public void discardResources​(int qty)
      Discard many resources as stated by by parameter qty
      Parameters:
      qty - quantity of resources to discard

    • storeInWarehouse

      public boolean storeInWarehouse​(Resource resource, int tier)
      Place the resource in the specified warehouse tier.
      Parameters:
      resource - resource the player wants to store
      tier - Warehouse inventory shelf's id on which the player want to place resource
      Returns:
      true if the storing ended successfully

    • storeInExtraStorage

      public boolean storeInExtraStorage​(Resource resource, StorageAbility extraStorage)
      Place the rescources in the leader card slots.

      Mind that the method will check if the player has the specified extraStorage leader active and if its storage type is compatible with resource type.

      Returns:
      true if it has correctly placed the resource, otherwise false.

    • chooseLeaders

      public void chooseLeaders​(java.util.List<LeaderCard> leaders)
      Let the player communicating his/her choice of leader: 2 out of the 4 given by the game.
      Parameters:
      leaders - chosen leaders

    • giveLeadersOptions

      public void giveLeadersOptions​(java.util.List<LeaderCard> leaders)
      Call the controller passing to the player the 4 options he/she has for the leader.

    • activateLeaderCard

      public boolean activateLeaderCard​(LeaderCard leader)
      Activate the leader card, only if the player has that card. From now on it's available for usage.
      Parameters:
      leader - chosen leaderCard to activate

    • getLeaderCards

      public java.util.List<LeaderCard> getLeaderCards()

    • discardLeaderCard

      public boolean discardLeaderCard​(LeaderCard leaderCard)
      Discard a leaderCard and give a Faith Point to the player.
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - card that the player wants to remove.
      Returns:
      true if it has removed the leader, false otherwise.

    • addFaithPoints

      public void addFaithPoints​(int quantity)
      Add the specified quantity of Faith Points causing the player to move forward on the board.

      If the movement causes a Vatican Report or the end of the match, the Game will be notified.

      Parameters:
      quantity - number of Faith Points the player gains

    • isInRangeForReport

      public boolean isInRangeForReport​(int vaticanReport)
      Given a vaticanReport (must be in 1-3 range), the method tells if the player is in a safe zone. If it returns true, then the player should activate the pope pass relating that zone.

    • startProduction

      public void startProduction​(java.util.List<ConcreteProductionCard> cards, ResourcesWallet resAsCash, java.util.List<BoostAbility> prodLeaders, java.util.List<Resource> outputBoost, boolean basicProd, java.util.Optional<Resource> outputBasic) throws BadStorageException
      For each ProductionCard in cards, it tries to consume all the resources planned by the player and requested by the specific ProductionCard's cost or BoostAbility's cost.

      Players must specify from which type of storage they want to obtain the resources needed to pay by distributing them in the resAsCash object.

      If the player wants to activate the BasicProduction power, he/she has to choose the outputBasic as well.

      If something goes wrong while producing (i.e. not enough resources, misplacement), the method will revert any changes done to Warehouse, LootChest and StorageAbility cards, without giving to the player the resources that it could have produced before the error's encounter.

      Players express their wish of activation of the basic production power by basicProd=true

      Parameters:
      cards - list of ProductionCard the player wants to activate and produce
      resAsCash - object that contains all the resources the player wants to use as currency for the production, well divided into their storage type
      prodLeaders - leaders whose effect the player would like to benefit. Mind that can only be BoostAbility and at max 2 of them.
      basicProd - true if the player wishes to activate the basic production power
      outputBasic - the Resource the player wants as an outcome from the basic production power
      outputBoost - list of desired outputs from the LeaderCard production with the Boost power. Mind that the player can possibly have at max 2 of these leaders, so he/she can use them to produce just 2 times at max per turn. This means just 2 outputBoost max. Must be in the same order as the corresponding prodLeader.
      Throws:
      BadStorageException

    • setExtraStorage

      public void setExtraStorage​(StorageAbility card)

    • resetExtraStorage

      public void resetExtraStorage​(java.util.List<StorageAbility> s)

      public void drawActionToken()
